summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from June 29, 2018, providing an update on a joint FBI-Albuquerque Police Department investigation into the 2016 homicide of a young girl. The email discusses arrests, forensic findings, an indictment of a John Doe based on DNA, and an upcoming guilty plea and press conference.

events.title: Homicide of a young girl
events.description: A young girl was brutally sexually assaulted, murdered, and dismembered. Initial information suggested her mother, a friend of the mother, and another friend participated in the homicide. The victim may have been drugged with methamphetamine and potentially prostituted or a victim of child pornography by her mother.

events.title: Guilty plea and press conference
events.description: The mother of the victim is scheduled to plead guilty to Child Abuse Resulting in Death in the afternoon. The Albuquerque Police Department scheduled a press conference for 2:00 PM to announce developments, including the indictment of a John Doe based on DNA evidence.

keyFacts: The case involves the 2016 homicide of a young girl who was sexually assaulted, murdered, and dismembered.
The victim's mother, a friend of the mother, and another friend were initially implicated and arrested by Albuquerque Police Department.
Forensic DNA analysis excluded the arrested individuals and led to the indictment of an unidentified 'John Doe'.
The victim's mother is pleading guilty to Child Abuse Resulting in Death and is expected to receive a 12-15 year sentence.
APD obtained authority to bug the mother's jail cell, anticipating she would make incriminating statements upon learning about the John Doe indictment.
